content:
• Tuesday, April 16, 2013
  • IAG

    IAMGOLD (NYSE:IAG) moves to correct earlier what it describes as an inaccurate media report on...

    IAMGOLD (NYSE:IAG) moves to correct earlier what it describes as an inaccurate media report on company spending at its Essakane mine in Burkina Faso. The company says it's maintaining previously announced capital spending plans of around $300M at Essakane this year, with about $200M of those funds earmarked for a project to expand its throughput capacity. The company expects to complete the project in Q4, with no other projects planned. An earlier report by Reuters had said the mine was going to require an additional $360M in expenditures.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:53 PM
  • ENDP

    Endo Health Solutions (NASDAQ:ENDP) trades higher after hours as the FDA says it won't approve...

    Endo Health Solutions (NASDAQ:ENDP) trades higher after hours as the FDA says it won't approve generic copies of the old version of OxyContin. The first patent on the old version expired today, and drug makers had been lining up to make copies. But the newer, reformulated OxyContin was found to be tougher to crush, break or dissolve, the FDA said, and "the benefits of the old formulation no longer outweigh its risks." Shares +5.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:34 PM
  • XSPA

    Vringo (VRNG) -2.7% AH after SA contributor Patent Plays makes note of a Google motion filed...

    Vringo (VRNG) -2.7% AH after SA contributor Patent Plays makes note of a Google motion filed today in which the search giant claims to have developed an AdWords workaround that would allow it to avoid infringing Vringo's IP. Though granting Google might be bluffing, the author believes otherwise, and notes Google's hard-line stance towards IP suits from non-practicing entities (NPEs) gives it extra motivation to try and dissuade would-be litigants.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:15 PM | 8 Comments
  • BPFH

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BPFH +14%. VXZ +9%. ENDP +6%. NMR +3%. HL +2%....

    After-hours top gainers, as of 5:15 p.m.: BPFH +14%. VXZ +9%. ENDP +6%. NMR +3%. HL +2%.
    After-hours top losers: PNFP -11%. QNST -8%. URI -4%. TMO -4%. YHOO -4%.

  • AMAT

    Chip equipment stocks slip a little in AH trading after Intel lowers its 2013 capex budget range...

    Chip equipment stocks slip a little in AH trading after Intel lowers its 2013 capex budget range by $1B to $11.5B-$12.5B. AMAT -1.2% AH. KLAC -0.8%. LRCX -0.7%. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • EOPN

    E2open (NASDAQ:EOPN) missed on both the top and bottom line after the bell but the company's...

    E2open (NASDAQ:EOPN) missed on both the top and bottom line after the bell but the company's guidance may have been the straw that broke the stock's back in after-hours trading. EOPN says it sees a loss of $0.33-0.36 for FY14 on revenue of just $77-79M, missing the Street's estimates of $0.04 per share on revenue of $89.16M by a wide margin. Shares -28.6% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:05 PM | 1 Comment
  • URI

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q1 beats on a per share basis but misses slightly on its top...

    More on United Rentals (NYSE:URI): Q1 beats on a per share basis but misses slightly on its top line. Despite the miss, revenue climbed 67% Y/Y as overall rates and time utilization met or exceeded expectations across the board. Rental revenue +5.4%, while time utilization increased 30 basis points year-over-year to 64.2%. The company has reaffirms its outlook for full year time utilization of approximately 68%. Shares -4.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:03 PM
  • AABA

    More on Yahoo: No guidance. Q1 display ad revenue (ex-TAC) -11% Y/Y to $402M, worse than Q4's...

    More on Yahoo: No guidance. Q1 display ad revenue (ex-TAC) -11% Y/Y to $402M, worse than Q4's -5%. Search ad revenue (ex-TAC) +6%, down from Q4's +14%. Display ads sold -7% (-10% prior), price per display ad -2% (+7% prior). Search paid clicks +16% (+11% prior), but search price-per-click -7% (+1% prior). Was Yahoo's sales restructuring and leadership transition to blame? $775M worth of buybacks, cash/investment balance fell by $600M to $5.4B. Sales/marketing spend -10% Y/Y, G&A +7%, R&D -4%. YHOO now -3.9% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast) (PR) (slides)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 1 Comment
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q1 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $12.58B (-2.5% Y/Y) misses by...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC): Q1 EPS of $0.40 misses by $0.01. Revenue of $12.58B (-2.5% Y/Y) misses by $30M. Expects Q2 revenue of $12.4B-$13.4B vs. $12.9B consensus. Expects "low single-digit" 2013 revenue growth, unchanged from prior guidance and compares with 0.7% consensus. Lowers 2013 capex guidance range by $1B to $11.5B-$12.5B. Shares +2.1% AH. CC at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:06 PM | 32 Comments
  • CSX

    CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.05. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)

    CSX (NYSE:CSX): Q1 EPS of $0.45 beats by $0.05. Shares +2.7% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM | 3 Comments
  • HK

    Halcon Resources (HK +9.3%) shares recoup a chunk of yesterday's 12% plunge which may have been...

    Halcon Resources (HK +9.3%) shares recoup a chunk of yesterday's 12% plunge which may have been exacerbated by HK's thin public float and high financial leverage. HK had unveiled a new Eagle Ford shale play and said it is fully engaged in the drilling development phase with 16 rigs operating. Also, Raymond James starts coverage at Outperform.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:54 PM
  • SAVE

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +5.1%) soars as its price target is lifted to $29 from $24 at Imperial...

    Spirit Airlines (SAVE +5.1%) soars as its price target is lifted to $29 from $24 at Imperial Capital, which reiterates a Buy on the stock following the company''s traffic report and updated guidance last week. A weak February due to schools canceling President's day vacation looks to have been make up and more by strong pent-up demand for holiday travel in March.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • NYMX

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX -0.8%) gives back gains made earlier in the day as the market shrugs...

    Nymox Pharmaceutical (NYMX -0.8%) gives back gains made earlier in the day as the market shrugs off its announcement of positive data on NX-1207, its treatment for benign prostatic hyperplasia. The company says the drug has no detectable effect on sexual function in test subjects. Other drugs that are currently used to treat prostate ailments frequently cause collateral damage to sexual organs.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:41 PM | 1 Comment
  • FPO

    First Potomac Realty (FPO +5.8%) gets a nice boost from a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight...

    First Potomac Realty (FPO +5.8%) gets a nice boost from a Morgan Stanley upgrade to Overweight from Equal-Weight. Analyst Vance Edelson sees "new portfolio management initiatives and progress on redevelopment properties" leading to higher-than-expected occupancy and a NAV of $18.30.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM
  • SYN

    Synthetic Biologics (SYN -1.2%) slips after reporting its year-end financials this morning,...

    Synthetic Biologics (SYN -1.2%) slips after reporting its year-end financials this morning, reiterating its focus on strengthening its infectious disease portfolio. The company says it's raised capital this year that includes $10.1M in net proceeds from the sale of about 6.8M shares. Other income was $15K, compared to an expense of $1.7M for the same period in 2011.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:05 PM
  • VVUS

    Vivus (VVUS +5%) spikes as the FDA approves its amendment and modification to the Risk...

    Vivus (VVUS +5%) spikes as the FDA approves its amendment and modification to the Risk Evaluation and Mitigation Strategy for Qsymia. The amendment, which was submitted last October, allows Qsymia to be dispensed through certified retail pharmacies in addition to the existing network of certified mail-order pharmacies, which reduces the prescribing burden for physicians and waiting times for patients seeking to initiate therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 5 Comments
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +3%) gains today after closing its 16.375M public offering at...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP +3%) gains today after closing its 16.375M public offering at $5.50 per share, just a 1% discount from yesterday's close. Net proceeds from the sale came to $84.5M, for which the company plans to use to fund R&D activities, including further clinical development of plecanatide and its other pipeline programs, as well as for other general corporate purposes.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • ACOR

    Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +11.2%) rises for a second day after AMPYRA shows promise for...

    Acorda Therapeutics (ACOR +11.2%) rises for a second day after AMPYRA shows promise for post-stroke deficit patients. Heard on the conference call: 1) "What got us here [is] an adherence to analysis in science [and] we're not going to deviate from that" just to get into a Phase III trial. 2) An 18-20% improvement in the timed 25-foot walk speed "correlates very well with various measures of clinically meaningful improvement," but the comparison between the current study and the MS study "is not apples-to-apples."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:17 PM
  • ASTI

    Microcap Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +4.9%) rallies after announcing Fry's Electronics will sell its...

    Microcap Ascent Solar (OTC:ASTI +4.9%) rallies after announcing Fry's Electronics will sell its EnerPlex line of solar-powered electronics accessories. Shares have largely tread water this year after tumbling last September and October. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • LOGI

    Logitech (LOGI +4.3%) catches a bid after announcing the $350 Harmony Ultimate and the $130...

    Logitech (LOGI +4.3%) catches a bid after announcing the $350 Harmony Ultimate and the $130 Harmony Smart Control. The Ultimate, a top-of-the-line universal remote, sports a 2.4" touchscreen, can control up to 15 devices, has a tilt sensor, and can program Philips Hue lighting systems. The Smart Control combines a basic universal remote with a smartphone app said to be capable of controlling 225K+ home theater devices. Logitech's remote sales fell 24% Y/Y in the Dec. quarter. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:51 PM
  • KKR

    More on the KKR (KKR +5.2%) upgrade: Sandler hikes KKR ahead of earnings, seeing a big beat of...

    More on the KKR (KKR +5.2%) upgrade: Sandler hikes KKR ahead of earnings, seeing a big beat of $0.87 vs. $0.78 expected. Strong fundraising continues, says Sandler, and realizations are continuing to build following a strong 2012 H2. The distribution could reach $1.24 this year, implying a yield of 6-7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • BB

    "Our Asia checks indicate [BB10 phone] builds have recently increased from 2M/month to 2M+,"...

    "Our Asia checks indicate [BB10 phone] builds have recently increased from 2M/month to 2M+," says Jefferies' Peter Misek, who returns from his Asian trip writing more favorably about BlackBerry (BBRY +1.9%) than Apple. Misek adds checks indicate "2-3 additional BB10 models are likely to launch before year end" - a mid-range QWERTY phone (the R-Series?), a mid-range touchscreen phone, and a 5" touchscreen phone. He also claims Z10 sell-through data is steady, and Q10 business channel pre-sales are strong. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 15 Comments
  • UNXL

    Midday top 10 gainers: UNXL +16%. CNIT-OLD +15%. ANEN +15%. CHCI +14%. SYNM +13%. PNFP +12%. EVC...

    Midday top 10 gainers: UNXL +16%. CNIT-OLD +15%. ANEN +15%. CHCI +14%. SYNM +13%. PNFP +12%. EVC +12%. ENPH +11%. NCQ +11%. ACOR +11%.
    Midday top 10 losers: JAXB -33%. KEYN -15%. SRPT -12%. CPGI -10%. GENE -10%. TRIT -9%. CCXI -9%. MAGS -9%. ADAT -8%. GAI -8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:59 PM
  • GILD

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +2%) gets a lift today after Deutsche Bank reiterates a Buy on the shares...

    Gilead Sciences (GILD +2%) gets a lift today after Deutsche Bank reiterates a Buy on the shares and ups its price target from $48 to $69. Deutsche says its built out a monthly HCV market model that includes its new HIV drug TAF as well as Sofosbuvir. The firm projects that Sofosbuvir alone can bring in up to $3.7B in 2014, $8.4B in 2015, and $12.4B at its peak, respectively. Just last week GILD submitted a New Drug Application for Sofsbuvir, saying the drug will shorten treatment time for HCV infection and "reduce or eliminate" the need for injectable treatments.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • ZAZA

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA +5.8%) announces the closing of an Eaglebine JV agreement with an unnamed...

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA +5.8%) announces the closing of an Eaglebine JV agreement with an unnamed partner who will receive up to a 75% working interest in up to 55K net acres and operate the JV acreage comprising 73K of ZaZa's 92K net mineral acres. ZaZa will retain a 25% working interest.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:49 PM
  • MSFT

    LinkedIn (LNKD +2.9%) outperforms after National Alliance Capital starts coverage with a Buy and...

    LinkedIn (LNKD +2.9%) outperforms after National Alliance Capital starts coverage with a Buy and $192 PT. Analyst Mike Hickey declares the business social networking giant's current risk/reward favorable, and sees few "realistic" competitive threats. Shares are just a few dollars away from their all-time high of $186.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 3 Comments
  • GOLD

    Analysts at RBC Capital think credit downgrades for some top gold miners are a strong...

    Analysts at RBC Capital think credit downgrades for some top gold miners are a strong possibility. There's a “moderate probability” Barrick Gold (ABX -0.1%) could trigger a one-notch downgrade at $1,400 gold; at $1,300, Newmont Mining (NEM +1.9%) could get downgraded, and Kinross Gold (KGC +1.8%) could get cut right to junk status. TD Securities also offers similarly disturbing conclusions. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 5 Comments
  • TMO

    Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO +3.5%) moves up today after Mizuho Securities ups the shares a to...

    Thermo Fisher Scientific (TMO +3.5%) moves up today after Mizuho Securities ups the shares a to a Buy on the back of yesterday's purchase of Life Technologies (LIFE +0.4%) for $76 per share. The firm also raises its target price to $90 from $80.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM
  • PXD

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +1.8%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at Canaccord, which says the...

    Pioneer Natural Resources (PXD +1.8%) is upgraded to Hold from Sell at Canaccord, which says the stock now reflects a reasonable outlook concerning the capital productivity of blended horizontal/vertical development in the Spraberry field. The firm sees 2013 production growth of ~16%, assuming the capital intensity of Spraberry development is comparable.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • MRIN

    Marin Software (MRIN +1.8%) ticks higher after receiving five bullish ratings (and no...

    Marin Software (MRIN +1.8%) ticks higher after receiving five bullish ratings (and no neutral/bearish ones) on underwriter coverage day. "With less than 5% share of global ad spend in ‘12, we believe MRIN has open skies ahead to fly at full throttle," writes UBS, touting Marin's leadership position in online/mobile ad management/analytics software. Shares are now up 7% from their March IPO price of $14, but remain well off their post-IPO high of $19.95. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:42 AM
  • ZIXI

    Zix Corporation (ZIXI +7.2%) rises after announcing it has settled litigation with RPost related...

    Zix Corporation (ZIXI +7.2%) rises after announcing it has settled litigation with RPost related to alleged patent infringement by ZIXI. The terms of the settlement were not disclosed.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM
  • IP

    Containerboard stocks rally after Macquarie turns bullish on the sector with the fundamentals...

    Containerboard stocks rally after Macquarie turns bullish on the sector with the fundamentals improving and more price hikes expected in the back half of the year. International Paper (IP +3.6%), KapStone Paper & Packaging (KS +3.8%), and Rock-Tenn (RKT +3.3%) are tagged as the firm's favorite names in the group.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:13 AM
  • GWW

    Shares of W.W. Grainger (GWW +7.2%) are up handily after this morning's earnings beat as the...

    Shares of W.W. Grainger (GWW +7.2%) are up handily after this morning's earnings beat as the company guides higher on the low end for FY2013 revenue and EPS. GWW "now expects 5-9% sales growth and EPS of $11.30-12.00," as daily sales growth should be 5-10% and gross margins should expand by 20-30 basis points going forward. The company also sees a $.05-.07 hit to FY2013 EPS from movements in the yen. (See earnings transcript)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:07 AM
  • VHC

    VirnetX (VHC +7.9%) jumps after Apple files a notice of withdrawal for its motion for sanctions...

    VirnetX (VHC +7.9%) jumps after Apple files a notice of withdrawal for its motion for sanctions in its ITC dispute with VirnetX. Apple and VirnetX had been granted an extension last week to "reach a written agreement" regarding Apple's motion, as VirnetX focuses on fighting Apple through U.S. district courts after $368M Texas verdict was upheld.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • WLT

    Activist investor Audley Capital, reeling after advisory firms ISS and Glass Lewis come out in...

    Activist investor Audley Capital, reeling after advisory firms ISS and Glass Lewis come out in support of Walter Energy (WLT -3.1%), strikes back with a new letter saying WLT's board is "ill prepared" to respond to met coal's continued price deterioration. Audley says WLT could face a liquidity crisis, and the board's "lack of sophistication" would make it difficult to pursue needed financing.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:51 AM | 1 Comment
  • BCRX

    Shares in BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +3.8%) are higher today after the company announces...

    Shares in BioCryst Pharmaceuticals (BCRX +3.8%) are higher today after the company announces it's completed its Type C meeting on peramivir with the FDA and confirmed that its proposed New Drug Application content supports a reviewable submission for the indication of acute uncomplicated influenza. The company says it's now in the process of requesting a pre-NDA meeting to reach agreement on a complete NDA submission and to address review issues identified in the minutes.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • VMC

    Vulcan Materials (VMC +4.8%) moves higher today after Sterne Agee ups the shares to Buy on...

    Vulcan Materials (VMC +4.8%) moves higher today after Sterne Agee ups the shares to Buy on valuation with a $55 price target. The firm says that end-market growth looks attractive, and the likelihood of several years of growth in U.S. construction will win out over near-term macroeconomic concerns.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.9%) drive higher to flirt with all-time highs. Not even a...

    Shares of Tesla Motors (TSLA +3.9%) drive higher to flirt with all-time highs. Not even a warning from Morgan Stanley that the automaker's Q1 profits might not be sustainable can put the brakes on the rally. TSLA +33.1% YTD.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:36 AM | 9 Comments
  • NWBO

    Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO +5.7%) racks up a solid gain this morning after saying...

    Northwest Biotherapeutics (OTCQB:NWBO +5.7%) racks up a solid gain this morning after saying that it's Phase III clinical trial for Glioblastoma multiforme brain cancer has been adopted as a national priority trial in the UK. The development was under the "adoption" program managed by the National Institute for Health Research, which is part of the UK's National Health System, and with it comes resources and operational support for the trial sites.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:30 AM
  • UNXL

    UniPixel (UNXL +8.7%) makes new 52-week highs after announcing Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK) will...

    UniPixel (UNXL +8.7%) makes new 52-week highs after announcing Eastman Kodak (EKDKQ.PK) will make touch sensors leveraging UniPixel's UniBoss film. The companies have begun to build a manufacturing/testing facility with 100K square feet of manufacturing space, and plan to spend $24M this year to improve/equip it. Kodak declares the partnership a part of its efforts to expand into functional printing. Last week, UniPixel announced a partnership with an unnamed "touchscreen ecosystem partner."

     
     
     
     
    | 10:18 AM | 3 Comments
  • WWW

    Wolverine Worldwide (WWW +4.7%) trades higher after the retailer beat estimates with its Q1...

    Wolverine Worldwide (WWW +4.7%) trades higher after the retailer beat estimates with its Q1 report. Recent acquisitions of the Sperry Top-Sider, Saucony, Stride Rite, and Keds brands helped boost the company's revenue haul, but higher costs drove down the gross margin rate by 40 bps Y/Y to 40.6% during the period.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • GOOG

    The specs for the first version of Google Glass are out: the device can take 5MP photos and...

    The specs for the first version of Google Glass are out: the device can take 5MP photos and record 720p video, has Bluetooth and 802.11 b/g Wi-Fi radios, and 16GB of storage. Google (GOOG +0.5%) claims a battery life of 1 day with normal use, and states viewing Glass' display is equal to watching a 25" HD screen from 8 feet away. Google has also begun rolling out Glass apps in Google Play, and has prohibited developers (for now, at least) from including ads in their apps, or charging for them. Himax (HIMX +7.7%), a rumored Glass supplier, seems to be getting a lift. (previous)
     
     
     
     
    | 10:00 AM | 3 Comments
  • TTM

    Tata Motors (TTM +6.1%) moves higher with Oppenheimer initiating the company with a somewhat...

    Tata Motors (TTM +6.1%) moves higher with Oppenheimer initiating the company with a somewhat surprising Outperform rating. Auto sales in India have been a major disappointment, but the firm thinks the automaker will be a major force in the luxury segment with its Jaguar and Land Rover brands.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:56 AM
  • GBX

    Greenbrier (GBX +2.3%) rises after getting its second upgrade in as many days as Sterne Agee...

    Greenbrier (GBX +2.3%) rises after getting its second upgrade in as many days as Sterne Agee takes the stock to Buy with a $28 price target. This comes on the heels of Longbow's Buy from Neutral call yesterday. The company has enjoyed quite a bit of upbeat sell-side coverage of late as BofA and Keybanc both upgraded the shares recently.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • SFTBF

    SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) responds to Dish's (DISH +1.8%) bid for Sprint (S +1.1%) by insisting its...

    SoftBank (OTCPK:SFTBF) responds to Dish's (DISH +1.8%) bid for Sprint (S +1.1%) by insisting its offer is superior, and stating it expects the deal to close by July 1. Nonetheless, some major Sprint shareholders, such as Westchester Capital (14M shares), are declaring Dish's offer better. SoftBank fell 6.8% in Tokyo as investors fret about a higher bid, and Sprint is adding a bit to yesterday's gains with the help of a JPMorgan upgrade to Overweight: the firm argues the Dish/SoftBank offers "likely put a floor under shares in the $7 range," and considers a bidding war possible. CLWR +1.9%. (more)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:41 AM
  • KEYN

    Keynote Systems (NASDAQ:KEYN) dives before the bell after releasing preliminary Q2 results. The...

    Keynote Systems (NASDAQ:KEYN) dives before the bell after releasing preliminary Q2 results. The company lowered both top and bottom line guidance saying four systems were not accepted by customers which prevented the recognition of $1.6M in revenue. Shares -11.6% premarket. 

     
     
     
     
    | 9:27 AM
  • ROVI

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) +2.6% after announcing Facebook will use the Rovi Video movie/TV...

    Rovi (NASDAQ:ROVI) +2.6% after announcing Facebook will use the Rovi Video movie/TV show/celebrity database to provide users "more ways to express the things they love on their profiles." The database will also be provided to 3rd-party Facebook developers to leverage in their apps, Rovi will have the benefit of being able to provide links to Facebook movie/TV show pages for integration in the social media products of customers. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:23 AM
  • NWBO

    Premarket gainers: OTCQB:NWBO +9%. GFI +7%. BCRX +7%. HK +7%. AU +7%. NG +6%. AUQ +6%. SAND +6%....

    Premarket gainers: OTCQB:NWBO +9%. GFI +7%. BCRX +7%. HK +7%. AU +7%. NG +6%. AUQ +6%. SAND +6%. GOLD +5%. KGC +5%.
    Losers: LDK -16%. SRPT -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:10 AM | 1 Comment
  • SRPT

    A downgrade from Leerink Swann to Market Perform from Outperform adds to Sarepta Therapeutics'...

    A downgrade from Leerink Swann to Market Perform from Outperform adds to Sarepta Therapeutics' (NASDAQ:SRPT) problems. The FDA's request has "prolonged uncertainty" and the need to run a Phase III trial preapproval could give GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) and Prosensa's drisapersen treatment a first-to-market advantage. SRPT shares now -10.17% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM | 2 Comments
  • OAK

    The private-equity space may see some action today as Sandler O'Neill ratchets up price...

    The private-equity space may see some action today as Sandler O'Neill ratchets up price estimates on Oaktree (NYSE:OAK), Blackstone (NYSE:BX), and KKR to $63, $25, and $24, respectively. Oaktree's distribution could reach $4.38 this year, says Sandler, implying a 9% yield. BX +1.3%, KKR +2.5% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:02 AM
  • EGY

    Vaalco Energy (NYSE:EGY) provides an update on its drilling activities offshore Gabon. Says it...

    Vaalco Energy (NYSE:EGY) provides an update on its drilling activities offshore Gabon. Says it successfully completed the new development well in the Avouma field, with initial production of ~3K bbl/day of oil. EGY +1.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:58 AM
  • LDK

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) -19.6% premarket after partially defaulting on a $24M bond due...

    LDK Solar (NYSE:LDK) -19.6% premarket after partially defaulting on a $24M bond due yesterday. LDK says it reached a settlement with two bondholders owning ~$16.5M of the 4.75% notes in a private negotiation by partially paying in cash, and negotiated a loan facility with these bondholders to repay the remaining debt.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:51 AM
  • MHRCQ

    Magnum Hunter (MHR) +5.4% premarket after issuing its Q1 operational update. Total daily...

    Magnum Hunter (MHR) +5.4% premarket after issuing its Q1 operational update. Total daily production nears 20K boe/day; MHR says it is not cutting its 2013 production guidance even after losing ~3,200 boe/day later this month due to its Eagle Ford sale.     Investors appear skeptical about the FDA's request for additional information from Sarepta...

    Investors appear skeptical about the FDA's request for additional information from Sarepta Therapeutics (NASDAQ:SRPT) regarding the company's Duchenne muscular dystrophy drug. CEO Chris Garabedian says he does not anticipate "an impact on SRPT's ongoing activities" from the FDA's request or from the delay it occasioned in the accelerated approval submission process. Nonetheless, the shares are -6.22% premarket.

  • RIO

    Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) says this year's copper output will be cut by ~125K metric tons after last...

    Rio Tinto (NYSE:RIO) says this year's copper output will be cut by ~125K metric tons after last week's landslide at its Bingham Canyon mine in Utah. As a result, Rio's raw copper output is likely to fall by ~1.6% to 540K tons and refined copper production to slip ~27%. Q1 total production from iron ore mines totaled 61.2M tons, +4% Y/Y but -8% Q/Q due to cyclones that struck Australia's Pilbara region. RIO +2.6% premarket.
